ADMINISTRATIVE LAW JUDGES RULING  GRANTING THE MOTION FOR PARTY STATUS OF SAN DIEGO COMMUNITY POWER On October 24, 2024, San Diego Community Power filed and served a motion for party status. The motion for party status complies with Rule 1.4(b) of the California Public Utilities Commissions (Commission) Rules of Practice and Procedure. No objections were received. This motion is GRANTED.  The Commission shall add San Diego Community Power as a party to the service list for this proceeding.

Administrative Law Judge’s Ruling Disposing of Various Motions Related to Californians for Balanced Energy Solutions and Southern California Gas Company. The March 13, 2019 Motion for Party Status of Californians for Balanced Energy Solutions is moot. The May 14, 2019 Sierra Club Motion to Deny Party Status of C4BES is moot. The May 14, 2019 Sierra Club Motion to Compel is granted. The June 19, 2019 SoCalGas Motion to Strike is denied. The August 20, 2019 Motion to Withdraw Party Status of C4BES is granted. C4BES is ordered to cite to this ruling in any future proceeding to which it becomes a party or to which it is now a party.
